patterns: Where can the grievances be sent?
How do I lodge the grievance?
responses:
The grievances can be sent to:

- The Department of Administrative Reforms and Public Grievances (pgportal.gov.in)
- The Department of Pensions and Pensioners' Welfare (DP&PW) (pgportal.gov.in/pension/)

The grievances can be lodged online on . In cases where internet facility is not available or even otherwise, the citizen is free to send her/his grievance by Post. There is no prescribed format.

The grievance may be written on any plain sheet of paper or on a Postcard / Inland letter and addressed to the Department. The grievance can also be filled through Common Service Centre.

patterns: How do I track my grievance?
responses: The grievance is acknowledged online or by post. A unique registration number is given to each grievance.

patterns: What are the contact details of the Nodal Officers of Public Grievances in Ministries/Departments?
responses: Every Central Ministry / Department has designated a Joint Secretary or a Director / Deputy Secretary, as its ‘Director of Grievances’. He / She is the nodal officer for redress of grievances on work areas allocated to that particular Ministry / Department.

patterns: After redress, can the grievance be re-opened for further correspondence about it having been closed without details etc.?
responses: No. In such situations, the citizen will have to lodge a fresh grievance drawing reference to the closed grievance, and call for details. Sometimes, the details are sent by post and mentioned in the final report. The postal delivery may be awaited before lodging a fresh grievance

patterns: What is the time limit for redress of grievance?
responses: Thirty (30) days. In case of delay an interim reply with reasons for delay is required to be given.

patterns: What action can be taken by me in case of non-redress of my grievance within the prescribed time?
responses: You may take up the matter with the Director of Public Grievances of the Ministry/Department concerned whose details are available on the pgportal.

patterns: What can a citizen do if he is not satisfied with the redressal of his grievance?
responses: An Appeal provision has been made for redressal of dis-satisfied grievances in respect of Central Ministry/Department identified through a mandatory feedback ratting to be given by the Citizen on disposal of the grievance by the Nodal Grievance Officers. The appeal needs to be filed by the applicant within 30 days.

1. The request for deactivation of a user account can be made through email to the CPGRAMS helpdesk (cpgrams-darpg@nic.in). The email should be sent from the registered email id only.

2. In case of deactivation, the user can not create an account with the same email-id/mobile but the user can make a request again to activate the same account.

patterns: How to change the details of the Nodal Grievance Officer and Nodal Appellate Authority in the portal?
responses: The concerned organisation (Ministries/Department/State Govt) can change the details with their log in credentials.

patterns: Whether the Department has operated any feedback call centre?
responses: Yes. Department has established Feedback call centre to get the feedback from the citizen on disposed grievance in case the feedback is not received through the portal. The call centre also assists in filling the appeal.
